paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant R878C, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: putative LQT phenocopy lacking the KCNQ1dup12 mutation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Although the rare KCNH2 missense variant was present in the putative LQT phenocopy lacking the KCNQ1dup12 mutation (V85), we did not observe a familial cosegregation with the LQT- or LQTplus seizure trait.

functional_data.summary: Electrophysiological characterization of the mutant channels hERG1-R878C upon heterologous expression in HEK293T cells did not reveal functional differences compared to wild-type hERG1.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2-R878C variant did not show familial cosegregation with the LQT- or LQTplus seizure trait.
variants.additional_notes: The KCNH2-R878C variant was not found to exert a substantial pathogenic effect on the LQT trait in this family.
key_quotes: Electrophysiological characterization of the mutant channels hERG1-R878C upon heterologous expression in HEK293T cells did not reveal functional differences compared to wild-type hERG1.
The rare KCNH2 missense variant was present in the putative LQT phenocopy lacking the KCNQ1dup12 mutation (V85).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant information was clearly presented in the text.
